class_description: Many contractors never join relevant associations that can produce revenue for them. Even worse they spend the duesÂ money and don't maximize the effectiveness of the association.We will layout how to determine what associations to join, how to work them and get business from your involvement. The single greatest way to find grouped customers and network contacts is right in your backyard association! Work them to the fullest and you'll never make a cold call again!
target_audience: Architects, General Contractors, Subcontractors, and Suppliers

class_speaker.post_content:
Author Tom Woodcock is nationally known as one of the most dynamic sales trainers and consultants in the country. He routinely speaks to thousands of contractors, sales personnel and suppliers concerning the sales skills necessary to compete in this intensely challenging construction industry. His personal success in sales is well documented and highly regarded. His latest book; "You're Not Sellin', They're Buyin'" is comprehensive in developing the proper sales skills, persona and methodology to rise above the competition.

His DVD series can literally be used as an individual or corporate training program. He's been featured on CNN and in USAToday as well as dozens of media outlets across the country. Tom is extremely entertaining in his approach and well studied in the dynamics that occur in bidding, quoting and developing customer brand loyalty. His high energy approach combined with practical applications can bring results immediately after his seminars.

His corporation, Seal the Deal, is sought after by trade associations, contractors, corporations, suppliers, construction expos and publications regularly. He currently writes for 4 publications, has 20 regular contractor clients and speaks to in excess of 10,000 construction industry individuals a year. Tom turned a Caterpillar rental territory from 2.5Mil to 10Mil in revenue in 18 months while raising margins by 2%! He also trained 325 sales reps for a 750 Mil nationwide equipment firm. In his first sales position at 19 yrs of age he took a 150K contractor sales territory to 2.5Mil in 1 year. His customized training programs hit areas targeted for improvement head on. He knows how to get people to buy and manage a sales effort to success!

title.rendered: Beating the Low Bid Game: Closing Deals in Construction

class_description: Stop letting price be the determining factor in winning projects! This topic deals specifically with the pressure to always be low. Learn the sales tools necessary to get the inside track in the bidding process. The goal being to consistently win projects and raise profitability on those projects. The most common mis-takes made in bidding are revealed and countered.
target_audience: Architects, General Contractors, Subcontractors, and Suppliers

title.rendered: Construction Scheduling â Keeping the Project on Track

class_description: Scheduling enables construction professionals to effectively manage projects, forecast completion dates, and communicate the overall construction plan. This session will discuss how to properly develop and manage a schedule throughout the project. Specific topics covered include scheduling basics; developing a realistic baseline schedule; critical path method (CPM) scheduling, revisions and updates to the schedule, and cost loading / resource loading and reporting.
target_audience: Owners, developers, general contractors, subcontractors, architects, engineers, government agencies, and military personnel

class_speaker.post_content:
Ms. Kate Hull, Managing Consultant, assists owners, contractors, and subcontractors on both proactive and forensic projects and has worked on more than 50 projects globally ranging in value from $1 million to $1.2 billion. Ms. Hull provides clients with the necessary foresight and planning to ensure their project goals are met. She performs critical path method (CPM) scheduling services, including preparation of the baseline schedule and monthly schedule updates for complex construction projects in industries such as government, healthcare, and residential mixed-use.

Ms. Hull specializes in guiding clients involved in complex construction-related disputes through the claims and litigation process. She evaluates project costs and schedules to quantify damages involving changed work, delay, acceleration, disruption and productivity loss. Ms. Hull is an active member of AACE International (AACE) and the Society of Women Engineers (SWE), currently serving on the Board of Directors for SWE as Speaker of the Senate.

She has been selected as a Top 20 Under 40 Industry Professional by Engineering News-Record, named a SWE Gulf Coast Region Emerging Leader, and honored as a SWE Distinguished New Engineer. Ms. Hull earned her master's degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Construction Engineering and Project Management and her bachelor's degree in Architectural Engineering from The University of Texas at Austin Cockrell School of Engineering.

Mr. Roberto Leandro, Associate Consultant, has nearly 10 years of international construction and project management experience. He worked his way up from Assistant Superintendent to Superintendent for an earthwork contractor. The experience prompted him to start an earthwork contractor business in Caracas, Venezuela, of which he is currently an equity holder. Mr. Leandro served as an Owner's Representative overseeing high-end mid-rise condominium construction projects.

He also performed research regarding contract time determination procedures for heavy highway construction projects on behalf of the University of Texas' Center for Transportation Research. He currently assists clients with updating cost-loaded schedules per USACE requirements and provides post-construction forensic analyses of schedule delay, productivity impact, and damages. Mr. Leandro is a certified project management professional (PMP).

title.rendered: Selling to the Heart: How Most Sales are Really Won

class_description:
In this seminar you will learn how most sales are really wonâ¦through communicating trust and not by having the lowest price. As an owner or manager, you first have to sell yourself before you can sell your company's products or services. This seminar will give you practical techniques to increase your sales skills by selling yourself first and using these emotional triggers with each prospect you meetâ¦

 

â¢ becoming a trusted advisor
â¢ discovering how people buy
â¢ igniting your passion
â¢ using testimonials
â¢ building self-confidence
â¢ using humor effectively
â¢ learning to really listen
â¢ being more creative
â¢ overcoming adversity
â¢ branding yourself/company
â¢ going the extra mile
â¢ thinking "WIN...WIN"
â¢ telling stories
â¢ solving problems
â¢ becoming a business partner
â¢ showing you really care
target_audience: General Contractors, Builders, Sub-Contractors, Developers, Home Builders, Remodelers, Interior Designers, Property Owners and Managers, Architects, and Engineers

class_speaker.post_content: JACK SCHERER is the founder and president of SALESTALENT, a company that focuses on Sales Training programs and targeted Sales Recruiting. He is the author of The 21 Laws of Sales Success and Selling to the Heart: How most sales are really won! In addition, he founded DRIVING PROFIT, a business consulting firm that helps entrepreneurs and business owners drive more profit from their businesses. Jack is also the author of Driving Profit: Start your own business service and win! Jack and his companies have been featured in USA TODAY, SUCCESS MAGAZINE, ADVERTISING AGE, ADWEEK, FRANCHISING WORLD, and other publications. He has presented seminars and workshops for the University of Georgia Small Business Development Centers, Georgia Tech/ATDC program, Georgia Society of CPAs, NARI, Atlanta Home Builders Association, Georgia Dept. of Economic Development, and other associations and colleges.

class_description:
Winning coaches have Playbooks that help them to develop consistent wins. Likewise, successful business owners and managers have their own Sales Playbooks to drive new salesâ¦ often doing more with less. Your takeaways from this seminar will beâ¦


â¢ Leading with a U.S.P. (Unique Selling Proposition that differentiates your business
â¢ Reaching new market segments and developing new value-added services
â¢ Developing a consistent sales process to close more sales
â¢ Presenting value and not using low price to win new customers
â¢ Recruiting top sales talent using a "sales DNA" assessment tool
â¢ Developing proven lead generation programs
â¢ Creating CLV (Customer Lifetime Value)
â¢ Using KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) to increase profitability


PLUS MORE!


Jack Scherer is the author of three books: "The 21 Laws of Sales Success", "Driving Profit" and "Selling to the Heart". He has been featured in USA Today, Success Magazine, Franchising World, Business Opportunities, and other national publications.
target_audience: General Contractors, Builders, Sub-Contractors, Developers, Home Builders, Remodelers, Interior Designers, Property Owners and Managers, Architects, and Engineers

title.rendered: Construction Projects Scheduling: Starting with the Right Foot!

class_description: No matter how large or small the construction project, an efficient, well-thought-out schedule is crucial to achieving success. The schedule manages all aspects of a job, such as adjusting staff requirements at various stages, overseeing materials deliveries and equipment needs, organizing inspections, and estimating time needs for curing and settlingâall of which requires a deep understanding on the part of the scheduler.
target_audience: General Contractors, Builders, Sub-Contractors, Developers, Home Builders, Remodelers, Interior Designers, Property Owners and Managers, Architects, and Engineers

class_speaker.post_content: â¢ Construction project management consultant, author, public speaker, and trainer. â¢ B.S., M.S., and Ph.D. in civil engineering, specialized in Construction Management.   Experience: Over 26 years diversified: â¢ Industrial: private and public sectors, in the U.S. and overseas. Positions occupied include project engineer / manager, cost estimator, planner / scheduler, project controls manager, cost manager, training manager. â¢ Academic: faculty member / professor, head of department. â¢ Extensive experience in continuing education and professional training around the world. Topics are mainly technical but also include soft skills.   Author of: â¢ Construction Project Scheduling and Control (currently 3rd edition) â¢ How to Estimate with Means Data: Basic Skills for Building Construction (currently 4th edition) â¢ Many articles; technical and other â¢ Many presentations in professional conferences such as PMI, AACE International, Primavera Users Conference. Also, a public speaker in many local, regional, and international events. â¢ An authority on project planning, scheduling, and project control; was part of the PMI team that wrote the first Project Scheduling certification (PMI-SP) exam in 2007. â¢ An advocate of holistic healthy living and sports

title.rendered: Learn EXACTLY what you should know about your website.

class_description:
Plus: Free Google Tools And Advice On How To Use Those Tools

Learn What Google Wants You To Know About Your Website: All about SEO, how it works, how to hold your SEO person accountable and exact ways to grow online visibility and traffic. Work with a Google Partner to set up free Google tools on your site. Then learn how to use them when you attend. Email us before the show and we will apply 2 free tools to your website: Support@strategicpointmarketing Subject line should read "Build Expo Free Gift." We will get in contact with you to set everything up. **You must attend the show to receive this gift**
target_audience: Architects, General Contractors, Subcontractors, Builders, and Engineers

class_speaker.post_content:
Straight talk from a Google Certified Partner that will show you EXACT ways to increase your online visitors and leads.
Bring your laptop with access to your Google Analytics and following along in real time to know exactly what Google is trying to tell you about your website. Then see where and how to improve your organic rankings before you leave the conference.

A Google Certified Partner, Joshua's teaches interactive conferences based on material received from Google. Plus hear real life stories of success and failures that business owners have had. These powerful, interactive conferences are jammed packed with information that Joshua received during weekly meetings with Google. This is information every business owner needs to know.

Before becoming a Google Partner, Joshua was an outsourced CMO for several large U.S. based companies. As a CMO over the last 9 years, Joshua has managed over $2.5 million in AdWords and Digital Marketing Budgets and managed more than 2,800 campaigns.
As a Bing Partner and Google Certified Partner, Joshua attends national conferences with some of the other great minds that influence SEO, digital marketing, and social media. Today, Joshua speaks all over the country helping businesses improve every element of their marketing.

class_description:
2 things matter when it comes to SEO (Search Engine Optimization)1. Be Seen = Visibility
2. Get Clicks = Organic Visits To Your Website

Wondering what Google is looking for and doing behind the scenes? Don't be confused by SEO people?

Hear about the past updates that Google has published and what will be coming in the next 12 months. Walk away knowing exact improvements and management tips you should be implementing online.

Some of the teaching material will include:
1. Google's Current and upcoming changes
2. Voice Search â What does the future look like
3. How to find what do your rank for / Online Visibility

In closing you can ask anything you have ever wondered about SEO to the Google Partner and get direct, honest, unfiltered feedback to your questions.
target_audience: General Contractors, Subcontractors, Builders, and Engineers

title.rendered: Maximizing Your Reporting Solutions in QuickBooksÂ®

class_description: When working with reports and progress invoicing, we'll be reviewing how to maximize the filters available, outside financial reports downloadable into your QuickBooksÂ® software, and how best to track your Work In Progress.

class_speaker.post_content:
Dwayne J. Briscoe, is a practicing Certified QuickBooks Pro AdvisorÂ® who has been certified 20+ times in various versions, including: Pro Series, Enterprise, Point of Sale, and Online. He founded Bookkeeping-Results over 10 years ago in order to not only help educate business owners about the utilization of QuickBooksÂ® but also how best to maximize their profitability both financially and minimize their tax liability.

Working with not only basic accounting and software training, but offering information on the correct set-up of their QuickBooksÂ® file, incorporation of appropriate entities, and potential implications has helped propel his clients through continuous and up-to-date educational information.

Based out of Houston, Texas, Dwayne has been a fixture in the community to not only work with for-profit businesses but also nonprofit micro-lenders such as Accion Texas and PeopleFund.
